author: Pamela Muse
text:
The Alliance for Innovation & iXP Corp California Workshop:
What is Intelligent Video Surveillance (IVS)?  It's the utilization of state-of-the-industry behavioral recognition functionality that proactively monitors real-time video feeds from multiple cameras on a 24/7/365 basis.  The behavioral actions are considered by the intelligence functionality regarding human(s) and/or object(s) and their movement(s), or non-movement(s), under specific circumstances and advise designated personnel when the IVS system detects suspicious activity.  After a video alert review by public safety and/or security personnel, a decision is made by them whether or not to dispatch public safety resources to the scene
When considering an IVS solution within local government, contemplate the positive primary results already experienced by others.  They include:
Crime Reduction
Reputation Enhancement - A byproduct of Crime Reduction
Force Multiplier For Patrol - Many more "eyes" looking for potential problems via "virtual policing"
Cost Effective with No Long-term Unfunded Overhang
Can be implemented in phases as funds allow
911 Center Consolidation/Managed Services
This portion of the workshop will focus upon 911 centers and the potential opportunities for service improvement while realizing cost savings for local government.  We will explore 911 center physical co-location, virtual co-location, consolidation and 911 center operations as a managed service.
